DOCNAME: RAPLEY AND OTHERS v. THE UNITED KINGDOM
TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON are NORP nationals who were born in DATE , DATE , and DATE and live respectively in GPE , GPE and GPE . They were represented before ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , of ORG .

The applicant ’s wife died on DATE , leaving CARDINAL children born in DATE and DATE . His claim for widows’ benefits was made on DATE and was rejected on DATE on the ground that he was not entitled to widows’ benefits because he was not a woman . The applicant lodged an appeal on DATE , which was decided and rejected on DATE . The applicant did not appeal further as he considered or was advised that such a remedy would be bound to fail since no such social security benefits were payable to widowers under GPE law .
